headline: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Charter Communications Soars as Subscriber Growth Impresses
summary: The S&P 500 added 0.7% on Friday, April 25, 2025, as China reportedly considered suspending tariffs on some U.S. goods, and tech stocks extended their rally.

headline: Why Is Charter (CHTR) Stock Soaring Today
summary: Shares of cable, internet, and telephone services provider Charter (NASDAQ:CHTR) jumped 11.2% in the afternoon session after the company reported strong first-quarter 2025 results, with earnings and EBITDA exceeding analysts' estimates, signaling improved cost control and solid profit growth. On the other hand, its number of internet subscribers missed. Zooming out, we think this was a decent quarter featuring some areas of strength but also some blemishes.

headline: Phillips 66, Boston Beer, Charter Communications: Trending Tickers
summary: With the trading session underway, Catalysts host Madison Mills and Yahoo Finance Markets Reporter Josh Schafer examine some of today's trending tickers. Phillips 66 (PSX) announces a wider-than-expected first quarter loss amid pressure from activist investors. Boston Beer Company's (SAM) first quarter earnings results beat expectations, but the company warned of a tariff impact of up to $30 million in 2025. Charter Communications's (CHTR) first quarter sales came in better than expected, with customer losses narrowing year over year. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: Charter Stock Jumps After Earnings. What’s Impressing Wall Street.
summary: Charter Communications  stock was rising Friday after the company topped Wall Street’s revenue estimates and added more mobile customers than expected.  Charter added 514,000 mobile line subscriptions over the quarter, beating the 448,000 adds that analysts were expecting.  The cable operator lost 60,000 internet customers, attributing 9,000 of those to disconnects during January’s California wildfires.

headline: Charter Communications beats revenue estimates on strength in mobile services
summary: (Reuters) -Charter Communications on Friday topped Wall Street estimate for first-quarter revenue and added more subscribers than expected for mobile services, thanks to strong demand for its bundled plans, sending its shares up about 10%.  The broadband and cable TV provider has benefited from its plans that offer customers the option to combine internet, TV and phone services into a single, customizable package.  Charter added 514,000 mobile lines during the first quarter, higher than the growth of 486,000 a year earlier and the Visible Alpha estimate of an increase of 477,410.

headline: Charter Communications (CHTR) Misses Q1 Earnings Estimates

headline: Charter’s (NASDAQ:CHTR) Q1 Earnings Results: Revenue In Line With Expectations
summary: Cable, internet, and telephone services provider Charter (NASDAQ:CHTR) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, but sales were flat year on year at $13.74 billion. Its GAAP profit of $8.42 per share was 0.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
